questions.clue: This 1960s musical about the French Revolution shares its name with a Victor Hugo novel.
The classic tale of a ship captain's obsession with a white whale was adapted into a 2010 film titled 'The Whale'.
This novel about an orphaned boy and a mysterious benefactor was adapted into a modern TV series called 'Dickensian'.
In 'The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen', this Bram Stoker character is a key member of the team.
This classic Russian novel by Leo Tolstoy was reimagined in a 2012 film, starring Keira Knightley as the tragic heroine.
This type of energy, harnessed from the sun, is one of the most abundant sources of renewable energy.
Wind turbines, often found in large farms, convert this natural force into electricity.
This type of renewable energy is derived from the heat stored within the Earth.
The process of using organic material, such as plant and animal waste, to produce fuel is known as this.
Known for its use of flowing water, this renewable energy source is currently the largest producer of renewable electricity and involves the construction of dams.
This city, the capital of France, is known as the 'City of Light'.
Formerly known as Leningrad, this Russian city was renamed in 1991.
The capital of Brazil was moved from Rio de Janeiro to this city in 1960.
This capital city of Japan was formerly known as Edo until 1868.
Before it was moved to Ankara, this city served as the capital of Turkey.
This Vietnamese soup is traditionally made with broth, rice noodles, herbs, and meat, often beef or chicken.
In Thailand, this dish features stir-fried rice noodles with eggs, tofu, and shrimp, typically garnished with peanuts.
A staple in Indonesian cuisine, this dish consists of rice cooked in coconut milk, often served with fried chicken or beef rendang.
In Malaysia, this spicy noodle soup is known for its rich broth made with a blend of spices and coconut milk.
In the Philippines, this dish consists of marinated meat, traditionally pork or chicken, cooked on bamboo skewers over charcoal.
This ancient Greek mathematician is known as the father of geometry.
In mathematics, this number is known as the base of the natural logarithm, approximately equal to 2.718.
This sequence starts with 0 and 1, and each subsequent number is the sum of the previous two.
This unsolved problem in number theory asks whether every even integer greater than 2 can be expressed as the sum of two primes.
This millennium prize problem concerns the existence and smoothness of solutions to the Navier-Stokes equations.

final.clue: Completed in 1889 for a world's fair, this iconic structure was initially criticized and described as a 'truly tragic street lamp'.
